titleStmt.title: A way to wooe a witty wench. Or, A dialogue between two lovers who meeting one day: the young-man desired the maiden to stay: the maid we was witty her self to defend, and so they concluded the match in the end. To a pleasant new tune, or, Musgroves march.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles. T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clark.,

notesStmt.note: Date and place of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "O my dearest do not grieve ..."
Item at A5:2[434] imperfect: trimmed at head affecting title.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
